name: üöÄ Welcome to TreeListy
description:
üéâ Welcome to TreeListy - Your Fractal Playground!

This interactive tour teaches TreeListy BY SHOWING, not telling.

üöÄ START HERE:
1. Click 'üé® Canvas' button (top right) to see this tree come alive
2. Explore Phase 1 (‚ú® See What's Possible) - real examples like Kyoto trip, Coffee shop, Film doc
3. Try Phase 2 (ü§ñ AI Superpowers) - right-click any field and select '‚ú® AI Suggest'
4. Ready to build? Phase 3 shows you how!

üí° PRO TIP: Toggle between Tree View and Canvas View anytime. Your data is always safe!

items.name: üé® Switch to Canvas View
items.description: Click the 'Canvas' button in the top header. This tree looks SPECTACULAR in Canvas mode - nodes positioned beautifully, connections visible!
items.notes: Try the Auto-Layout dropdown: Hierarchical, Timeline, Force-Directed, Radial, Grid (6 algorithms)

subItems.name: Drag nodes around to rearrange
subItems.description: Middle-click drag any node to reposition. Ctrl+Click to select multiple nodes, then middle-click drag to move them together! Nodes snap to grid when Grid mode is enabled. Keyboard: Ctrl+A (select all), Escape (clear selection).

subItems.name: Scroll mouse wheel to zoom in/out
subItems.description: Zoom from 10% to 500%. Pan by dragging empty space. Grid snapping keeps it clean.

subItems.name: Click 'Grid' to snap everything perfectly
subItems.description: Professional layouts in one click. Toggle between Tree View and Canvas View anytime.

items.name: üìÇ How Hierarchy Works
items.description: We break big scary goals into tiny manageable steps. Phases ‚Üí Items ‚Üí Subtasks ‚Üí Sub-subtasks (infinite depth!)

subItems.name: Phases hold Items (major stages)
subItems.description: Like chapters in a book, quarters in a year, acts in a play

subItems.name: Items hold Subtasks (components)
subItems.description: The work packages, scenes, deals, or features that make up each phase

subItems.name: Subtasks can nest infinitely
subItems.description: Drill down as deep as you need. TreeListy handles complexity at any scale.

subItems.name: Like this nested subtask!
subItems.description: And you can keep going...

children.name: ‚ú® See What's Possible
children.subtitle: Real examples that inspire
children.description: Three concrete examples showing travel, business, and creative use cases

items.name: üåè Weekend in Kyoto, Japan
items.description: TreeListy for travel planning - budget tracking, itinerary, dependencies. Total budget: $800 (see how it rolls up from items below!)
items.notes: Switch to 'Event Planning' pattern for specialized travel fields

subItems.name: Day 1: Fushimi Inari 10,000 Gates
subItems.description: Iconic vermillion torii gates climbing the mountain. Free entry, arrive early (7am) to beat crowds. Wear comfortable shoes - 2 hour hike to summit.

subItems.name: Day 2: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove & Monkey Park
subItems.description: Magical bamboo forest + mountain monkeys with Kyoto city views. JR train from Kyoto Station.

subItems.name: Day 3: Traditional Tea Ceremony
subItems.description: Authentic tea ceremony in historic machiya townhouse. Learn the rituals, taste matcha, wear kimono (optional +$40).

subItems.name: Accommodation: Ryokan near Gion
subItems.description: Traditional Japanese inn with tatami mats, futon bedding, kaiseki dinner. 2 nights.

subItems.name: Food & Transportation
subItems.description: Ramen, sushi, street food, local buses, trains. Budget $150/day for 2 days.

items.name: ‚òï Launch Coffee Shop in 6 Months
items.description: TreeListy for business planning - dependencies are CRITICAL here. Notice: can't lease space before funding, can't open before permits!
items.notes: Try 'Strategic Planning' pattern for investment tracking and KPIs

subItems.name: Secure funding ($150K)
subItems.description: SBA loan ($100K) + personal savings ($50K). Bank requires business plan, 3-year projections, personal guarantee.

subItems.name: Lease commercial space (1200 sq ft)
subItems.description: High foot traffic location, corner unit preferred, 5-year lease with 2-year option. Negotiable rent escalation clause.
subItems.notes: BLOCKED until funding secured - can't sign lease without capital

subItems.name: Get permits & licenses
subItems.description: Health dept, business license, food handler, fire safety inspection. Allow 6-8 weeks for approvals.
subItems.notes: BLOCKED until lease signed - permits require physical address

subItems.name: Buy equipment ($50K)
subItems.description: Espresso machine ($15K), grinder ($3K), POS system ($2K), furniture ($15K), initial inventory ($15K)

subItems.name: Grand Opening!
subItems.description: Soft launch (friends/family), grand opening event, local press, social media blitz. First 100 customers get free coffee!
subItems.notes: BLOCKED until permits approved and equipment installed

items.name: üé¨ Film a Short Documentary
items.description: TreeListy for creative projects - Pre-production ‚Üí Production ‚Üí Post-production. Switch to 'Film' pattern for scene breakdowns, shot lists, prompts!
items.notes: AI Prompt Design pattern can help with Sora/Veo video generation prompts

subItems.name: Pre-production: Storyboard & Budget
subItems.description: 15-min doc about local coffee roasters. Interview 3 owners, shoot roasting process, edit narrative arc.

subItems.name: Production: 5 days of filming
subItems.description: 3 days interviews, 2 days B-roll (coffee farms, roasting, latte art). 4K camera, wireless lav mics, 3-point lighting.

subItems.name: Post-production: Edit & Color Grade
subItems.description: Premiere Pro edit (40 hours), DaVinci color grade (10 hours), sound mix (8 hours), motion graphics title cards.

children.name: ü§ñ AI Superpowers
children.subtitle: Right-click magic
children.description: TreeListy has 3 AI providers (Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT) with specialized tools

items.name: üí° Smart Suggest - Context-Aware Field Completion
items.description: RIGHT-CLICK THIS DESCRIPTION FIELD ‚Üí Select '‚ú® AI Suggest' ‚Üí Watch Claude rewrite it with domain expertise!
items.notes: The AI reads the entire tree context + pattern + sibling items to give expert-level suggestions. Try it on Budget, Timeline, Description, Notes!

subItems.name: Step 1: Double-click this item to open Edit Form
subItems.description: The edit panel appears on the right side with all fields

subItems.name: Step 2: Right-click any field label
subItems.description: Try Description, Notes, or Cost fields - each gets contextual AI help

subItems.name: Step 3: Select '‚ú® AI Suggest' from menu
subItems.description: AI analyzes pattern, tree context, dependencies, and generates expert suggestion

items.name: üßô AI Wizard - Conversational Tree Building
items.description: Click 'AI Wizard' in the footer (bottom toolbar). Have a conversation about your project - AI builds the tree as you talk! Uses Smart Merge to protect existing work.
items.notes: Try: 'I want to write a book about climate change' or 'Help me plan a wedding for 150 guests'

subItems.name: AI asks 5-6 questions about your project
subItems.description: Pattern-specific questions based on domain expertise (Philosophy prof, Sales strategist, Film director, etc.)

subItems.name: After each answer, tree grows automatically
subItems.description: Watch phases and items appear in real-time as conversation progresses

subItems.name: Click 'Finish & Apply' when satisfied
subItems.description: Smart Merge protects your existing data while adding new AI suggestions

items.name: üìÑ Analyze Text - Document to Tree Conversion
items.description: Click 'Analyze Text' in footer. Paste messy meeting notes, research paper, email thread ‚Üí AI extracts hierarchical structure automatically!
items.notes: Quick Mode (30s) or Deep Mode (2min with Extended Thinking). Try pasting a Wikipedia article!

subItems.name: Quick Mode: Fast structure extraction
subItems.description: 30-second analysis for meeting notes, emails, simple documents

subItems.name: Deep Mode: Extended Thinking analysis
subItems.description: 2-minute deep reasoning for complex documents, research papers, legal briefs. Requires your API key.

items.name: üî¨ AI Review - Quality Analysis
items.description: Click 'AI Review' in footer. AI analyzes entire tree for gaps, inconsistencies, missing dependencies, budget issues. Like having a project manager review your work!
items.notes: Provides actionable recommendations with severity ratings (Critical, Warning, Info)

children.name: üöÄ Build Your Own
children.subtitle: Ready to create?
children.description: Now that you've seen the possibilities, start your own project

items.name: üéØ Choose Your Pattern
items.description: Click the Pattern dropdown in header. 16 specialized patterns: Generic, Philosophy, Sales, Film, Roadmap, AI Prompts, Gmail, Events, Fitness, Strategy, Course Design, Family Tree, Dialogue, Book Writing, Filesystem
items.notes: Each pattern has specialized fields, custom terminology, and AI expert persona. Philosophy = Dialectics. Sales = Pipeline. Film = Scenes. Fitness = Sets/Reps!

subItems.name: Generic: Universal project planning
subItems.description: Infrastructure, corporate, research - works for everything

subItems.name: Philosophy: Analyze Plato's Cave, Hegel's dialectics
subItems.description: Thesis ‚Üí Antithesis ‚Üí Synthesis structure

subItems.name: Sales: Track pipeline, deals, quarters, forecasting
subItems.description: Deal value, close date, lead source, competitor analysis

subItems.name: Film: Scenes, shots, Sora/Veo prompts
subItems.description: Pre-production ‚Üí Production ‚Üí Post-production workflow

items.name: ‚ûï Start Fresh or Use AI Wizard
items.description: Two paths: (1) Click 'New' and build manually, or (2) Click 'AI Wizard' for conversational guided building. AI Wizard is faster and helps you think through structure!
items.notes: Manual building gives you full control. AI Wizard asks smart questions and builds as you answer.

items.name: üì§ Share Your Tree
items.description: Click 'Share' button to generate a compressed URL. Email it, Slack it, tweet it. Recipients get your exact tree loaded instantly - no account needed!
items.notes: URLs use LZString compression - entire tree fits in a shareable link. Also export to JSON (git-friendly) or Excel (4 professional sheets).

items.name: üé® Explore Canvas View
items.description: 6 auto-layout algorithms: Hierarchical (top-down tree), Timeline (left-to-right), Force-Directed (physics simulation), Radial (circular), Grid (organized grid). Plus manual positioning. Try them all!
items.notes: Drag individual nodes, zoom 10%-500%, grid snapping, pan by dragging empty space. Phase zones color-coded. Dependency arrows auto-routed.
